name: Matrix4
comment: 4D Matrix. Values are stored in column major order.

fromBuffer.name: fromBuffer
fromBuffer.comment: Constructs Matrix4 with a vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.storage that views given vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.Matrix4-fromBuffer.buffer starting at vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.Matrix4-fromBuffer.offset. vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.Matrix4-fromBuffer.offset has to be multiple of [Float32List.BYTES_PER_ELEMENT].

*.comment: Returns a new vector or matrix by multiplying this with vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.*.arg.

+.comment: Returns new matrix after component wise this + vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.+.arg

-.comment: Returns new matrix after component wise this - vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.-.arg

setColumns.name: setColumns
setColumns.comment: Sets the entire matrix to the column values.

setFrom.name: setFrom
setFrom.comment: Sets the entire matrix to the matrix in vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.setFrom.arg.

setFromTranslationRotation.name: setFromTranslationRotation
setFromTranslationRotation.comment: Sets the matrix from translation vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.setFromTranslationRotation.arg0 and rotation vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.setFromTranslationRotation.arg1.

setUpper2x2.name: setUpper2x2
setUpper2x2.comment: Sets the upper 2x2 of the matrix to be vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.setUpper2x2.arg.

setDiagonal.name: setDiagonal
setDiagonal.comment: Sets the diagonal of the matrix to be vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.setDiagonal.arg.

translate.name: translate
translate.comment: Translate this matrix by a vector_math/vector_math.Vector3, vector_math/vector_math.Vector4, or x,y,z

scale.name: scale
scale.comment: Scale this matrix by a vector_math/vector_math.Vector3, vector_math/vector_math.Vector4, or x,y,z

absolute.name: absolute
absolute.comment: Returns the component wise absolute value of this.

dotRow.name: dotRow
dotRow.comment: Returns the dot product of row vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.dotRow.i and vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.dotRow.v.

dotColumn.name: dotColumn
dotColumn.comment: Returns the dot product of column vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.dotColumn.j and vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.dotColumn.v.

trace.name: trace
trace.comment: Returns the trace of the matrix. The trace of a matrix is the sum of the diagonal entries.

infinityNorm.name: infinityNorm
infinityNorm.comment: Returns infinity norm of the matrix. Used for numerical analysis.

getTranslation.name: getTranslation
getTranslation.comment: Returns the translation vector from this homogeneous transformation matrix.

setTranslation.name: setTranslation
setTranslation.comment: Sets the translation vector in this homogeneous transformation matrix.

setTranslationRaw.name: setTranslationRaw
setTranslationRaw.comment: Sets the translation vector in this homogeneous transformation matrix.

getRotation.name: getRotation
getRotation.comment: Returns the rotation matrix from this homogeneous transformation matrix.

setRotation.name: setRotation
setRotation.comment: Sets the rotation matrix in this homogeneous transformation matrix.

copyInverse.name: copyInverse
copyInverse.comment: Set this matrix to be the inverse of vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.copyInverse.arg

setRotationX.name: setRotationX
setRotationX.comment: Sets the upper 3x3 to a rotation of vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.setRotationX.radians around X

setRotationY.name: setRotationY
setRotationY.comment: Sets the upper 3x3 to a rotation of vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.setRotationY.radians around Y

setRotationZ.name: setRotationZ
setRotationZ.comment: Sets the upper 3x3 to a rotation of vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.setRotationZ.radians around Z

scaleAdjoint.name: scaleAdjoint
scaleAdjoint.comment: Converts into Adjugate matrix and scales by vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.scaleAdjoint.scale

absoluteRotate.name: absoluteRotate
absoluteRotate.comment: Rotates vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.absoluteRotate.arg by the absolute rotation of this Returns vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.absoluteRotate.arg. Primarily used by AABB transformation code.

copyFromArray.name: copyFromArray
copyFromArray.comment: Copies elements from vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.copyFromArray.array into this starting at vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.copyFromArray.offset.

hashCode.name: hashCode
hashCode.comment:
Get a hash code for this object.

All objects have hash codes. Hash codes are guaranteed to be the same for objects that are equal when compared using the equality operator ==. Other than that there are no guarantees about the hash codes. They will not be consistent between runs and there are no distribution guarantees.

If a subclass overrides vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.hashCode it should override the equality operator as well to maintain consistency.

runtimeType.name: runtimeType
runtimeType.comment: A representation of the runtime type of the object.

==.comment:
The equality operator.

The default behavior for all dart-core.Objects is to return true if and only if this and vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.==.other are the same object.

Override this method to specify a different equality relation on a class. The overriding method must still be an equivalence relation. That is, it must be:

  • Total: It must return a boolean for all arguments. It should never throw or return null.

  • Reflexive: For all objects o, o == o must be true.

  • Symmetric: For all objects o1 and o2, o1 == o2 and o2 == o1 must either both be true, or both be false.

  • Transitive: For all objects o1, o2, and o3, if o1 == o2 and o2 == o3 are true, then o1 == o3 must be true.

The method should also be consistent over time, so equality of two objects should not change over time, or at least only change if one of the objects was modified.

If a subclass overrides the equality operator it should override the vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.hashCode method as well to maintain consistency.

toString.name: toString
toString.comment: Returns a string representation of this object.

noSuchMethod.name: noSuchMethod
noSuchMethod.comment:
vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.noSuchMethod is invoked when users invoke a non-existent method on an object. The name of the method and the arguments of the invocation are passed to vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.noSuchMethod in an dart-core.Invocation. If vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.noSuchMethod returns a value, that value becomes the result of the original invocation.

The default behavior of vector_math/vector_math.Matrix4.noSuchMethod is to throw a dart-core.NoSuchMethodError.
